definition: (of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume

sentences.english: Small tables can be transformed into Shuzhuangtai, followed by the exquisite Shuzhuangjing side.
sentences.chinese: 小桌子可以改造成梳妆台，之后是一面玲珑的梳妆镜。

sentences.english: Small tables can be transformed into Shuzhuangtai, followed by the exquisite Shuzhuangjing side.
sentences.chinese: 小桌子可以改造成梳妆台，之后是一面玲珑的梳妆镜。

sentences.english: She's always primping in front of the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 她总是在镜子前梳妆打扮。

sentences.english: Two reliable sources of toys are dresser tops and wastebaskets. There are several types of cat toys.
sentences.chinese: 有两个可靠的玩具来源，分别是梳妆台上面和废纸篓。

sentences.english: There is a layer of dust on the dressing-table.
sentences.chinese: 梳妆台上盖着一层灰尘。

sentences.english: She also asked that her dresser be silver.
sentences.chinese: 把梳妆台涂成银色也是她主动要求的。

sentences.english: The dresser could go against wall.
When evening came, Jean Valjean went out; Cosette dressed herself.
sentences.chinese: 黄昏时，冉阿让出去了，珂赛特动手梳妆。

sentences.english: History is a little girl, dressed and made up by people.
sentences.chinese: 历史是个小姑娘，任人梳妆打扮。

sentences.english: She cares nothing for dressing up.
sentences.chinese: 她对梳妆打扮一点也不感兴趣。

sentences.english: Chang E enters medicine Tibet the dressing table in hundred valuable chest, but unexpectedly is seen by loose Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥将药藏进梳妆台的百宝匣里，不料被蓬蒙看到了。

sentences.english: There are two dressing closest and a large ensuite bath.
sentences.chinese: 有两个大型梳妆衣柜和一个大浴室套间。

sentences.english: Dressing is difficult for her since her accident.
sentences.chinese: 她自从遭到事故后，梳妆时甚觉困难。

sentences.english: The history is a young girl, Let people to doll up foppery.
sentences.chinese: 历史是个小姑娘，任人梳妆打扮。

sentences.english: On the countertop, add a neat stack of new white towels and scented reeds.
sentences.chinese: 在梳妆台面上，加上一打整洁的新白毛巾和芳香棒儿。

sentences.english: She went over to the dresser and struck a match, lighting the gas.
sentences.chinese: 她走到梳妆台前，划了根火柴，点亮了煤气灯。

definition: same as 整裝|整装/to get ready (for a journey)
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
antique bronze mirror with flower petal edging, most commonly from the Tang dynasty
please take off your coat (honorific)/loose-fitting garment
face powder and eyebrow liner/cosmetics/(fig.) beautiful woman
